intro: Hamosa rattanoides, commonly known as the bamboo rattan, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and durable stems, it is occasionally cultivated for horticultural purposes.
